co_located_events.name: QuEMaLeS 2025
co_located_events.description: Workshop on Quality Evaluation of Machine Learning Software Systems
topics_of_interest: Quality models and metrics for ML-based systems
paper_format: Technical and experience papers: up to 12 pages
New ideas and short papers: up to 8 pages

co_located_events.name: PATH 2025
co_located_events.description: Promoting and Dealing with Advanced Technology in Healthcare
topics_of_interest: Secure data management and privacy in healthcare software
Ethical and regulatory issues in AI for healthcare
Evaluation methodologies and real-world case studies

co_located_events.name: A-SPPI 2025
co_located_events.description: International Workshop on Analytics for Software Product and Process Improvement
topics_of_interest: Analysis of software data to support decision making
AI and machine learning for software analytics
Teaching software analytics and process improvement

summary.description: The workshops provide forums for researchers, practitioners, and policymakers to present and discuss recent advancements and challenges in software engineering and its intersection with machine learning, healthcare technologies, and software analytics.
summary.publication_details: Accepted papers will be published in a Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) proceedings volume.
summary.candidate_requirements: At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the workshop and present the work.
summary.submission_guidelines: All submissions must be in English, original, and not under review or published elsewhere. Papers must conform to the Springer LNCS formatting guidelines.
